title: Understanding ODD
text: Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD) is a behavioral condition often diagnosed in children. It involves a pattern of angry, irritable mood, $$\frac{argumentative}{defiant}$$ behavior, or vindictiveness.

hintAnswer: behavioral condition in which the child has symptoms of being uncooperative, defiant, and may be hostile toward people in authority
title: Characteristics of ODD
text: What are some common symptoms of ODD?
choices: behavioral condition in which the child has symptoms of being uncooperative, defiant, and may be hostile toward people in authority
children experience chronic, intense, angry outbursts
strategy for preventing a recurring problematic behavior by first identifying why a behavior keeps recurring and then devising a plan to prevent recurrences
